entry.tran: 使(信仰、价值观等)内在化;吸收
entry.def: If you internalize something such as a belief or a set of values, you make it become part of your attitude or way of thinking.

example.ex: Over time she internalized her parents' attitudes.
example.tran: 随着时间的流逝她认同了父母的看法并将之融为自我意识的一部分。

example.ex: ...a social order which depends on internalized feelings of what is right and wrong.
example.tran: 依赖内化的是非观来维持的社会秩序

means.word_mean: 1. learning (of values or attitudes etc.) that is incorporated within yourself
